docTitle.titlePart:
Epicuticular Wax of Euphorbia aphylla Brouss. ex. Willd.,
Euphorbiaceae

byline.docAuthor: Paul-Gerhard Gülz, Jutta Bodden, Edith Müller

byline.affiliation: Botanisches Institut der Universität zu Köln,
Institut für Biochemie der Universität zu Köln, An der Bottmühle 2,

front.dedication: Dedicated to Professor Hans Reznik on the occasion of his 65th birthday
front.keyword:
Euphorbia aphylla, Epicuticular Wax Composition, Triterpenols, Triterpenones, Triterpenol
Esters
front.div:
Quantity and composition of epicuticular wax of Euphorbia aphylla were examined. The wax
contained the common lipid components «-alkanes, wax esters, pr. alcohols, fatty acids and in
traces aldehydes and acetates all occurring in homologous series. Additionally, several triter-
penols such as ß-amyrin, a-amyrin, lupeol and simiarenol were found. With the exception of
simiarenol these triterpenols occurred free as well as esterified with acetic acid and fatty acids.
The ketones, oleanen-3-one, ursen-3-one and lupen-3-one have also been identified.
